intro: Bigelowia leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth-seeded bigelowia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Bigelowia leiosperma is often found in coastal and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
